Physical Exam: Inspection of the chest and respiratory rate
Justification: To assess for any visible abnormalities, such as asymmetry, use of accessory muscles, or signs of respiratory distress.
To check for any areas of tenderness, crepitus, or abnormal vibrations (fremitus) that may indicate underlying issues.
To listen for normal breath sounds and any abnormal sounds such as wheezing, crackles, or decreased breath sounds that could indicate infection or obstruction.
To assess for areas of dullness or hyperresonance that may indicate fluid accumulation or other abnormalities in the lungs.

Physical Exam: Examination of the throat and nasal passages
Justification: To check for signs of infection, such as redness, swelling, or discharge that may contribute to the cough.

Physical Exam: Assessment of vital signs (temperature, heart rate, respiratory rate, blood pressure)
Justification: To evaluate the overall health status and identify any signs of systemic infection or distress.
